is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks

Interface GattPeripheral


  • public interface GattPeripheral
    Represents a Bluetooth Low Energy device that communicates over a gatt profile.

    All Observable objects returned by a GattPeripheral must be subscribed to before they will perform their work. No guarantees are made about what scheduler the Observables will do, and yield their work on.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  GattPeripheral.BondStatus
      Marks an int as containing one of the bond status constants from GattPeripheral.
      static interface  GattPeripheral.ConnectivityStatus
      Marks an int as containing one of the connectivity status constants from GattPeripheral.
      static interface  GattPeripheral.PacketHandler
      Responsible for encoding and decoding packets for the Bluetooth stack.
      static class  GattPeripheral.WriteType
      Determines how a command will be written to a peripheral.

      • createOperationTimeout

        OperationTimeout createOperationTimeout(java.lang.String name,
                                        long duration,
                                        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Returns a new OperationTimeout for use with the GattPeripheral.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use when printing out status updates for the timeout.
        duration - The amount of time to elapse before the timeout expires.
        timeUnit - The time unit of the duration.
        Returns:
        A new OperationTimeout

      • connect

        rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> connect(OperationTimeout timeout)
        Attempts to create a gatt connection to the peripheral.

        Does nothing if there is already an active connection.

        Yields an ConnectionStateException if called when peripheral connection status is changing.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to apply to the connect operation.

        Important: The order in which you connect and create bonds depends on the device's Android version. createBond() for more info.

      • disconnect

        rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> disconnect()
        Ends the gatt connection of the peripheral.

        Does nothing if the peripheral is already disconnected.

        Yields a ConnectionStateException if the peripheral is currently connecting.

      • getConnectionStatus

        @GattPeripheral.ConnectivityStatus
int getConnectionStatus()
        Returns the connection status of the Peripheral.
        See Also:
        STATUS_DISCONNECTED, STATUS_CONNECTING, STATUS_CONNECTED, STATUS_DISCONNECTING

      • createBond

        rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> createBond()
        Creates a bond to the peripheral from the current device.

        Does nothing if the device is already bonded.

        Important: the behavior of this method varies depending on the device's Android version. In API levels 18 and 19 (JB and KitKat), this method can only be called if the GattPeripheral is currently connected.

        However, starting in API level 21 (Lollipop), this method will fail if you call it when the device is connected. If you need a bond, you should call this method before you call connect(OperationTimeout).

      • removeBond

        @NonGuaranteed
rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> removeBond(OperationTimeout timeout)
        Removes any bond to the peripheral from the current device. Does nothing if the device is not bonded.

        Note: this method does not exhibit the same inconsistent behavior that createBond() does between device Android versions.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to apply to the operation.
        See Also:
        The current implementation of this method depends on the existence of a private method on {@code BluetoothDevice}, and may stop functioning in a future release of Android. Tested through API level 23.

      • getBondStatus

        @GattPeripheral.BondStatus
int getBondStatus()
        Returns the bond status of the peripheral.
        See Also:
        BOND_NONE, BOND_CHANGING, BOND_BONDED

      • discoverServices

        rx.Observable<java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,GattService>> discoverServices(OperationTimeout timeout)
        Performs service discovery on the peripheral.

        Yields a ConnectionStateException if the peripheral is not connected when this method is called.

      • discoverService

        rx.Observable<GattService> discoverService(java.util.UUID serviceIdentifier,
                                           OperationTimeout timeout)
        Performs service discovery on the peripheral, yielding the service matching a given identifier.

        If the service cannot be found, this method will yield a ServiceDiscoveryException.

        Yields a ConnectionStateException if the peripheral is not connected when this method is called.

        See Also:
        discoverServices(OperationTimeout)

rx.Observable<java.util.UUID> enableNotification(GattService onGattService,

                                                             java.util.UUID descriptorIdentifier,
                                                             OperationTimeout timeout)
        Deprecated. Prefer GattCharacteristic.enableNotification(UUID, OperationTimeout) for all new code.

rx.Observable<java.util.UUID> disableNotification(GattService onGattService,
                                                              java.util.UUID characteristicIdentifier,
                                                              java.util.UUID descriptorIdentifier,
                                                              OperationTimeout timeout)
        Deprecated. Prefer GattCharacteristic.disableNotification(UUID, OperationTimeout) for all new code.

      • writeCommand

        @Deprecated
rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> writeCommand(GattService service,
                                                       java.util.UUID characteristic,
                                                       GattPeripheral.WriteType writeType,
                                                       byte[] payload,
                                                       OperationTimeout timeout)
        Deprecated. Prefer GattCharacteristic#write(WriteType, byte[], OperationTimeout) for all new code.
        Writes a given payload to a characteristic belonging to a service on the peripheral.

        Important: it appears on some devices that writes are asynchronous on multiple levels. Although the stack may report the write was successful, it doesn't mean the write has actually completed. If you're going to disconnect after a write operation, it's a good idea to add a delay of a few seconds.

        The value of writeType is supposed to be automatically inferred during service discovery, but some devices do not consistently populate the value (Verizon Note 4). As such, this value must be provided for every write command call.

        Parameters:
        service - The service to write to.
        characteristic - The characteristic to write to.
        writeType - The type of write to perform.
        payload - The payload to write. Must be 20 bytes or less.
        timeout - The timeout to wrap the operation within.
        Returns:
        An observable that will emit a single null value, then complete upon success.

      • setPacketHandler

        void setPacketHandler(GattPeripheral.PacketHandler dataHandler)
        Associates a given packet handler with the GattPeripheral.

        Characteristic read and change data will be sent to the packet handler for processing, and outward propagation.

        While it is not required that you provide a packet handler, it is strongly recommended.
